title: Board game recommendations for "Help me destroy my friends (but like, nicely)..."
prompt: Help me destroy my friends (but like, nicely)

recommendations.title: Catan
recommendations.sommelierPitch: Trade your way to victory, but watch your back when you’re on the road to monopolize the board!
whyItFits: Classic resource management where friendly negotiations can quickly turn into backstabbing tactics. Perfect for those who like to play nice until it’s time to crush dreams.

recommendations.title: Ticket to Ride
recommendations.sommelierPitch: All aboard for a delightful journey that will have your friends derailing each other's plans with a smile!
whyItFits: On the surface, it’s all about connecting cities, but don’t be fooled—blocking routes can feel like a devious act of sabotage among friends.

recommendations.title: Cosmic Encounter
recommendations.sommelierPitch: The game where every alien has a secret power, and trust is just a temporary illusion—perfect for friendly betrayal!
whyItFits: With each player having unique powers, alliances can shift quicker than friendships at a game night. Prepare for chaos wrapped in laughter!

recommendations.title: Saboteur
recommendations.sommelierPitch: Digging for gold has never been so treacherously fun; will you be the miner or the sneaky saboteur?
whyItFits: Engage in a charming yet backstabbing race to riches, where your friends’ smiles may betray the daggers they’re hiding behind their backs.

recommendations.title: Betrayal at House on the Hill
recommendations.sommelierPitch: Uncover haunted secrets with friends—until one of you turns into a backstabbing monster, literally!
whyItFits: This game combines cooperative exploration with a twist of betrayal, ensuring that friendships are tested as ghosts and monsters emerge in the most delightful way.

recommendations.title: 7 Wonders
recommendations.sommelierPitch: Build a civilization with your friends, while secretly eyeing their cities like a jealous neighbor with a lawn that’s too green!
whyItFits: Drafting cards to build wonders is a delightful way to strategize, but watch out when your friends start eyeing your resources and plans with envy.

recommendations.title: Power Grid
recommendations.sommelierPitch: It’s like Monopoly, but instead of buying hotels, you’re snatching up power plants and dousing your friends in spite!
whyItFits: A strategic economic game where you can outmaneuver your friends in the battle for energy dominance, all while maintaining that sweet veneer of friendliness.

recommendations.title: The Resistance
recommendations.sommelierPitch: A game of deception where trust is a commodity and betrayal is just a part of the strategy—cuz who needs friends when you have lies?
whyItFits: Perfect for those who love to create intrigue amongst their group, as players must root out spies while trying not to betray their comrades (too much).

recommendations.title: Scythe
recommendations.sommelierPitch: Build your empire, crush your rivals, and sip tea while you do it—this is cutthroat strategy at its finest!
whyItFits: This gorgeous game combines area control and engine-building, and your friends won’t know what hit them as you obliterate their dreams of victory!
